content:
SkewTransform Class

Definition

Represents a 2-D skew.

In this Article

public sealed class SkewTransform : System.Windows.Media.Transform

Remarks

A SkewTransform is useful for creating the illusion of 3-dimensional depth in a 2-D object.

Freezable Features: Because it inherits from the Freezable class, the SkewTransform class provides several special features: SkewTransform objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by Freezable objects, see Freezable Objects Overview.

Constructors

SkewTransform()

Initializes a new instance of the SkewTransform class.

public SkewTransform ();

SkewTransform(Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of the SkewTransform class that has the specified x- and y-axes angles and is centered on the origin.

public SkewTransform (double angleX, double angleY);
angleX
Double

The x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. For more information, see the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX* property.

angleY
Double

The y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. For more information, see the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY* property.

SkewTransform(Double,Double,Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of the SkewTransform class that has the specified x- and y-axes angles and center.

public SkewTransform (double angleX, double angleY, double centerX, double centerY);
angleX
Double

The x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. For more information, see the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX* property.

angleY
Double

The y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. For more information, see the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY* property.

centerX
Double

The x-coordinate of the transform center. For more information, see the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX* property.

centerY
Double

The y-coordinate of the transform center. For more information, see the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY* property.

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty AngleYProperty;

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX* dependency property.

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty CenterYProperty;

Properties

AngleX

Gets or sets the x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis.

public double AngleX { get; set; }
Value
Double

The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. The default is 0.

Remarks

To skew an object in place, set the CenterX and CenterY properties to the object's center point.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field AngleXProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

AngleY

Gets or sets the y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

public double AngleY { get; set; }
Value
Double

The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. The default is 0.

Remarks

To skew an object in place, set the CenterX and CenterY properties to the object's center point.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field AngleYProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

CenterX

Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the transform center.

public double CenterX { get; set; }
Value
Double

The x-coordinate of the transform center. The default is 0.

Remarks

To skew an object in place, set the CenterX and CenterY properties to the object's center point.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field CenterXProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

CenterY

Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the transform center.

public double CenterY { get; set; }
Value
Double

The y-coordinate of the transform center. The default is 0.

Remarks

To skew an object in place, set the CenterX and CenterY properties to the object's center point.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field CenterYProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Value

Gets the current transformation value as a Matrix.

public override System.Windows.Media.Matrix Value { get; }
Value
Matrix

The current skewing transformation value as a Matrix.

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable copy of this SkewTransform by making deep copies of its values.

public System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform Clone ();
Returns
SkewTransform

A modifiable deep copy of the current object. The stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property of the cloned object returns false even if the stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property of the source is true.

Remarks

Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only Freezable objects. For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

When this method copies dependency properties, it copies resource references and data bindings although they might no longer resolve. It does not copy animations or their current values.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable copy of this SkewTransform object by making deep copies of its values. This method does not copy resource references, data bindings, or animations, although it does copy their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
SkewTransform

A modifiable deep copy of the current object. The stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property of the cloned object is false even if the stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property of the source is true.

Remarks

Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only Freezable objects. For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

CreateInstanceCore() 

protected override System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore ();
Returns
Freezable
